publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3474 Cathy Jamieson: Karly Burns, Glasgow School of Art Student—That the Parliament commends art student Karly Burns, who has dedicated her time to running community art workshops for adults at Starting Point, a mental health project provided by the voluntary organisation, Momentum; notes that Ms Burns suffers from cystic fibrosis; congratulates the service users who Ms Burns worked with for producing art work that was part of an exhibition at Glasgow School of Art entitled "Practice in Progress: Progress in Practice"; recognises the contribution that community art workshops have made in giving people an opportunity to express themselves creatively in a supportive environment, and notes that one in four people in Scotland are affected by mental health problems at some point in their life. Supported by: Bill Kidd*, Kenneth Gibson*, Alasdair Allan*, Stuart McMillan*, Duncan McNeil*, Malcolm Chisholm*, Bill Butler*, John Scott*, Ms Wendy Alexander*, Bob Doris*, Sandra White*, Mary Mulligan*, Margaret Curran*, Jamie McGrigor*, Angela Constance*, David Stewart*, Robin Harper*
S3M-3474 Karly Burns, Glasgow School of Art Student (lodged on 18 February 2009) Hugh O’Donnell*, Patrick Harvie*, Trish Godman*
S3M-3474 Karly Burns, Glasgow School of Art Student (lodged on 18 February 2009) Jamie Hepburn*, Gil Paterson*, Marilyn Livingstone*
S3M-3474 Karly Burns, Glasgow School of Art Student (lodged on 18 February 2009) Hugh Henry*
S3M-3474 Karly Burns, Glasgow School of Art Student (lodged on 18 February 2009) Karen Whitefield*
S3M-3474 Karly Burns, Glasgow School of Art Student (lodged on 18 February 2009) Mr Frank McAveety*
S3M-3474 Karly Burns, Glasgow School of Art Student (lodged on 18 February 2009) Ken Macintosh* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
